description_html:
This gallery contains images of America's Founding Fathers.

The American Presidents 1700s-1800s gallery contains images of other Founding Fathers.
story_html:
This gallery is a work in progress. It currently contains only one portrait, of Alexander Hamilton, based on Ron Chernow's biography, which inspired the popular musical by Lin-Manuel Miranda.

You can find spiritual portraits of George Washington, John Adams, and Thomas Jefferson in the American Presidents 1700s-1800s gallery on this site. I will be adding images of additional Founding Fathers, such as Ben Franklin and James Madison, as time permits.

To keep up to date, follow this site on social media or join the SeeOurMinds.com email list!

image_list.title: Alexander Hamilton
image_list.subtitle_html: First Secretary of the Treasury of the USA — Sep. 11, 1789 to Jan. 31, 1795
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Alexander Hamilton's spiritual portrait shows he is extremely decisive.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents X's dominant personality trait, iNtuition: idealism and hope for the future; openness to ideas; preference for ideas over facts.
The Blue in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their preference for seeing the world in terms of ideas more than facts.

The Green in this spiritual portrait represents X's dominant personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; preference for logic/reson/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

The Green in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their preference for making logical/rational/objective rather than emotional/personal/subjective decisions; their preference for making logical/rational/objective decisions.

The Red in this spiritual portrait represents X's dominant personality trait, Feeling: passion; amiability; friendliness; compassion; warmth; preference for emotion/empathy/subjectivity over logic/reason/objectivity; their preference for the emotional/personal/subjective over the logical/rational/objective.

The Red in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their preference for making emotional/personal/objective rather than logical/rational/objective decisions; their preference for making emotional/personal/subjective decisions.
The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents X's dominant personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to experiences; preference for facts over ideas.
The Yellow in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their preference for seeing the world in terms of facts more than ideas.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (NOTE THAT IS EASIER TO FIND EXAMPLES OF DECISIONS THAN PERCEPTIONS!) ....
